title: Authors and Citation
text: Joshua Lorin. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Lorin J (2023). gavir: Custom Functions Gavi. R package version 0.1.0, https://joshualorin.github.io/gavir/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {gavir: Custom Functions for Gavi},   author = {Joshua Lorin},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://joshualorin.github.io/gavir/}, }

title: Custom Functions for Gavi
text: package suite helper functions can used Gavi. functions help simplify repeat procedures, like loading common data, gavi specific colors themes plots tables, functions add filter common varibles like country groupings iso3 codes.

title: Custom Functions for Gavi
text: can install development version gavir GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("joshualorin/gavir")

title: Custom Functions for Gavi
text: can use get_*() functions load data: theme_*() scale_*() functions allow standard gavi formatting colors:
code: library(gavir) library(tidyverse, warn.conflicts = F, verbose = F) #> ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.2 ── #> ✔ ggplot2 3.4.3     ✔ purrr   1.0.2 #> ✔ tibble  3.2.1     ✔ dplyr   1.1.2 #> ✔ tidyr   1.3.0     ✔ stringr 1.5.0 #> ✔ readr   2.1.4     ✔ forcats 0.5.2 #> ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── #> ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() #> ✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()  # all functions require a version date get_groupings("2023-07") #> Reading in groupings file dated: 2023-07 #> Interesting! The groupings file you have selected is not the most recent. If this was unintentional, you can update to the most recent file, which is 2023-08 #> # A tibble: 196 × 61 #>    iso3  iso3_num iso2  country  country_short lang  global gavi77 gavi73 gavi72 #>    <chr>    <dbl> <chr> <chr>    <chr>         <chr>  <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl> #>  1 AFG          4 AF    Afghani… Afghanistan   eng        1      1      1      1 #>  2 AGO         24 AO    Angola   Angola        eng        1      1      1      1 #>  3 ALB          8 AL    Albania  Albania       eng        1      1      0      0 #>  4 AND         20 AD    Andorra  Andorra       eng        1      0      0      0 #>  5 ARE        784 AE    United … United Arab … eng        1      0      0      0 #>  6 ARG         32 AR    Argenti… Argentina     eng        1      0      0      0 #>  7 ARM         51 AM    Armenia  Armenia       eng        1      1      1      1 #>  8 ATG         28 AG    Antigua… Antigua and … eng        1      0      0      0 #>  9 AUS         36 AU    Austral… Australia     eng        1      0      0      0 #> 10 AUT         40 AT    Austria  Austria       eng        1      0      0      0 #> # ℹ 186 more rows #> # ℹ 51 more variables: gavi68 <dbl>, gavi57 <dbl>, gavi55 <dbl>, mics45 <dbl>, #> #   dov96 <dbl>, vimc112 <dbl>, who_region <chr>, gavi_region <chr>, #> #   gavi_region_short <chr>, pef_type <chr>, continental_africa <dbl>, #> #   francophone <chr>, indo_pacific <dbl>, regional_je <dbl>, #> #   regional_mena <dbl>, regional_yfv_2016 <dbl>, regional_yfv_2020 <dbl>, #> #   regional_ipv <dbl>, segments_2020 <chr>, segments_2021 <chr>, …  # and most have additional parameters you can fiddle with get_ihme("2023-02", source = "subnational", vaccine = "dtp3") #> Reading in Subnational IHME file dated 2023-02 and aggregated to polio shapes #> Rows: 1217964 Columns: 17── Column specification ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Delimiter: "," #> chr (8): iso3, admin2, admin2_code, vaccine, admin1, admin1_code, pop_model,... #> dbl (9): year, coverage, pu1_final, unvax_total, pct_unvax, upper, lower, pu... #> ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data. #> ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message. #> # A tibble: 405,988 × 17 #>    iso3  admin2         admin2_code  year vaccine coverage pu1_final unvax_total #>    <chr> <chr>          <chr>       <dbl> <chr>      <dbl>     <dbl>       <dbl> #>  1 ETH   MAO KOMO SPEC… {00061F00-…  2000 dtp3       0.174     1723.       1424. #>  2 ETH   MAO KOMO SPEC… {00061F00-…  2001 dtp3       0.269     1760.       1287. #>  3 ETH   MAO KOMO SPEC… {00061F00-…  2002 dtp3       0.255     1792.       1335. #>  4 ETH   MAO KOMO SPEC… {00061F00-…  2003 dtp3       0.215     1807.       1419. #>  5 ETH   MAO KOMO SPEC… {00061F00-…  2004 dtp3       0.259     1846.       1368. #>  6 ETH   MAO KOMO SPEC… {00061F00-…  2005 dtp3       0.299     1885.       1320. #>  7 ETH   MAO KOMO SPEC… {00061F00-…  2006 dtp3       0.339     1906.       1261. #>  8 ETH   MAO KOMO SPEC… {00061F00-…  2007 dtp3       0.385     1931.       1188. #>  9 ETH   MAO KOMO SPEC… {00061F00-…  2008 dtp3       0.455     1955.       1065. #> 10 ETH   MAO KOMO SPEC… {00061F00-…  2009 dtp3       0.485     1958.       1007. #> # ℹ 405,978 more rows #> # ℹ 9 more variables: pct_unvax <dbl>, admin1 <chr>, admin1_code <chr>, #> #   pop_model <chr>, pop_adjustment <chr>, upper <dbl>, lower <dbl>, #> #   pu1_uncalib <dbl>, pu1_calib <dbl> wuenic %>%  filter(iso3 == "AFG" & vaccine %in% c("dtp1", "dtp3")) %>%  ggplot(aes(year, coverage, color = vaccine)) +  geom_line() +  geom_point() +  scale_color_gavi() +   theme_gavi()

title: Add Gavi groups — add_gavi_group
text: function takes data frame adds specified Gavi groups .

title: Add Gavi groups — add_gavi_group
code: add_gavi_group(data, ...)

title: Add Gavi groups — add_gavi_group
text: data data frame. Required column labeled iso3 iso3 country codes. ... group groups groupings file.

title: Add Gavi groups — add_gavi_group
text: data frame added groups

title: Add Gavi groups — add_gavi_group
code: wuenic %>% add_gavi_group(country, who_region) #> Uh oh! You're missing the groupings file! Add it using get_groupings()  #> NULL

what: Add iso3 code to data — add_iso3
title: Add iso3 code to data — add_iso3
text: function adds iso3 code data frame, using country synonyms file match country.

title: Add iso3 code to data — add_iso3
code: add_iso3(data)

title: Add iso3 code to data — add_iso3
text: data data frame. Required column labeled country.

title: Add iso3 code to data — add_iso3
text: data frame iso3 code.

title: Add iso3 code to data — add_iso3
code: data.frame(country = c("DRC", "Congo", "Malawi"), value = 1) %>% add_iso3() #> Error: `path` does not exist: ‘C:/Users//Gavi/Measurement, Evaluation and Learning - Documents/CPMM/Datasets/Country Groupings/synonyms/country_synonyms.xlsx’

title: Filter by gavi groups — filter_gavi_group
text: function takes data frame, adds grouping file filters specified group filter values. removes filter group.

title: Filter by gavi groups — filter_gavi_group
code: filter_gavi_group(data, group, group_value, drop = TRUE)

title: Filter by gavi groups — filter_gavi_group
text: data data frame. Required column labeled iso3 iso3 country codes. group group groupings file. group_value value vector filter data . Must correspond values found group variable. drop defaults TRUE, drops filter variable. Use FALSE wish keep filter varible.

title: Filter by gavi groups — filter_gavi_group
text: filtered data frame.

title: Filter by gavi groups — filter_gavi_group
code: groupings <- get_groupings("2022-11") #> Error in charToDate(x): character string is not in a standard unambiguous format  wuenic %>% filter_gavi_group(gavi57, 1) #> Uh oh! You're missing the groupings file! Add it using get_groupings()  #> Error in UseMethod("select"): no applicable method for 'select' applied to an object of class "NULL"  wuenic %>% filter_gavi_group(who_region, c("AFRO", "EMRO")) #> Uh oh! You're missing the groupings file! Add it using get_groupings()  #> Error in UseMethod("select"): no applicable method for 'select' applied to an object of class "NULL"

title: Gavi colors — gavi_colors
text: Gavi colors

title: Gavi colors — gavi_colors
code: gavi_colors(...)

title: Gavi colors — gavi_colors
text: ... list gavi color labels

title: Gavi colors — gavi_colors
text: character vector color names labels hex numbers values

title: Gavi colors — gavi_colors
code: # Example one - use to get hex number for gavi color gavi_colors("blue") #>      blue  #> "#1A3C58"   # Example two - use with a geom call to provide color library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: ‘dplyr’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’: #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’: #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union library(ggplot2) wuenic %>%   filter(iso3 == "AFG" & vaccine == "dtp3") %>%   ggplot(aes(year, coverage)) +   geom_line(color = gavi_colors("penta"))   # Example three - pair with `as_vector()` to manually set colors wuenic %>%   filter(iso3 == "AFG" & vaccine %in% c("dtp3", "mcv1")) %>%   ggplot(aes(year,coverage, color = vaccine)) +   geom_line() +   geom_point() +   scale_color_manual(values = as.vector(gavi_colors("penta", "mcv")))

what: Load in the groupings file — get_groupings
title: Load in the groupings file — get_groupings
text: function loads country groupings file current environment

title: Load in the groupings file — get_groupings
code: get_groupings(version_date)

title: Load in the groupings file — get_groupings
text: version_date string format "yyyy-mm", corresponding version country groupings file wish load.

title: Load in the groupings file — get_groupings
text: data frame country groupings

title: Load in the groupings file — get_groupings
code: get_groupings("2022-07") #> Error in charToDate(x): character string is not in a standard unambiguous format  # can also save as object to re-use groupings <- get_groupings("2022-07") #> Error in charToDate(x): character string is not in a standard unambiguous format

title: Retrieve IHME data — get_ihme
text: Retrieves IHME data shared drive.

title: Retrieve IHME data — get_ihme
code: get_ihme(   version_date,   source = "subnational",   aggregation = "polio",   vaccine = NULL,   with_admin = F,   with_admin_date = NULL )

title: Retrieve IHME data — get_ihme
text: version_date string format "yyyy-mm", corresponding version IHME file wish load. source string used determine IHME file load. Options : "national", "subnational", "raster", "national_citations", "subnational_citations". aggregation string used determine aggregation use loading subnational data. Options : "polio" "gadm" vaccine string vector used determine vaccine use loading raster citation data. Use standard vaccine format (e.g. "dtp1"). Required reading raster citation files, otherwise leaving NULL read vaccines. with_admin TRUE, loads version subnational file includes admin data. with_admin_date NULL, loads latest ihme/admin subnational file. string format "yyyy-mm-dd" can also used specify exact version file.

title: Retrieve IHME data — get_ihme
text: data frame raster object.

title: Retrieve IHME data — get_ihme
code: #defaults load subnational file aggregated to polio shapes get_ihme("2022-12") #> Warning: no non-missing arguments to max; returning -Inf #> Reading in Subnational IHME file dated 2022-12 and aggregated to polio shapes #> Error: 'C:/Users//Gavi/Measurement, Evaluation and Learning - Documents/CPMM/Datasets/Coverage/IHME/Subnational/2022-12/polio aggregations/outputs/ihme_subnational_coverage_polio_2022-12.csv' does not exist.  get_ihme("2022-11", "national") #> Warning: no non-missing arguments to max; returning -Inf #> Reading in National IHME file dated: 2022-11 #> Error: 'C:/Users//Gavi/Measurement, Evaluation and Learning - Documents/CPMM/Datasets/Coverage/IHME/National/2022-11/outputs/ihme_national_coverage_2022-11.csv' does not exist.  get_ihme("2022-12", "raster", vaccine = "dtp1") #> Warning: no non-missing arguments to max; returning -Inf #> Reading in DTP1RasterRaster IHME file dated: 2022-12 #> The legacy packages maptools, rgdal, and rgeos, underpinning the sp package, #> which was just loaded, will retire in October 2023. #> Please refer to R-spatial evolution reports for details, especially #> https://r-spatial.org/r/2023/05/15/evolution4.html. #> It may be desirable to make the sf package available; #> package maintainers should consider adding sf to Suggests:. #> The sp package is now running under evolution status 2 #>      (status 2 uses the sf package in place of rgdal) #> Warning: C:/Users//Gavi/Measurement, Evaluation and Learning - Documents/CPMM/Datasets/Coverage/IHME/Subnational/2022-12/rasters/dpt1_cov_mean_raked_2000_2021.tif: No such file or directory (GDAL error 4) #> Error in .rasterObjectFromFile(x, objecttype = "RasterBrick", ...): Cannot create a RasterLayer object from this file. (file does not exist)  get_ihme("2022-12", "citations", vaccine = "dtp3") #> Warning: no non-missing arguments to max; returning -Inf

title: Retrieve JRF data — get_jrf
text: Retrieves JRF data shared drive. NOTE: works 2021 later versions.

title: Retrieve JRF data — get_jrf
code: get_jrf(version_date, source = "admin", guids = FALSE)

title: Retrieve JRF data — get_jrf
text: version_date string format "yyyy-mm-dd", corresponding version JRF file wish load. source string used determine format JRF file load. Options : "admin" (default), "official", "system.", "subnational". guids Use TRUE want file GUIDs. relevant subnational data.

title: Retrieve JRF data — get_jrf
text: JRF data frame.

title: Retrieve JRF data — get_jrf
code: get_jrf("2022-08-03") #> Reading in JRF Admin file dated: 2022-08-03 #> Warning: cannot open compressed file 'C:/Users//Gavi/Measurement, Evaluation and Learning - Documents/CPMM/Datasets/Coverage/JRF/Admin/2022/outputs/jrf_admin_2022-08-03.rds', probable reason 'No such file or directory' #> Error in gzfile(file, "rb"): cannot open the connection  get_jrf("2022-09-02", "subnational", guids = TRUE) #> Reading in JRF Subnational file dated: 2022-09-02 #> Warning: cannot open compressed file 'C:/Users//Gavi/Measurement, Evaluation and Learning - Documents/CPMM/Datasets/Coverage/JRF/Subnational/2022/outputs/jrf_subnational_GUIDS_2022-09-02.rds', probable reason 'No such file or directory' #> Error in gzfile(file, "rb"): cannot open the connection  # to dynamically always pull most recent file get_jrf(get_jrf_dates("official", latest = TRUE), "official") #> Warning: no non-missing arguments, returning NA #> Reading in JRF Official file dated: NA #> Warning: cannot open compressed file 'C:/Users//Gavi/Measurement, Evaluation and Learning - Documents/CPMM/Datasets/Coverage/JRF/Official/NA/outputs/official_jrf_NA.rds', probable reason 'No such file or directory' #> Error in gzfile(file, "rb"): cannot open the connection

what: Retreive dates of JRF files — get_jrf_dates
title: Retreive dates of JRF files — get_jrf_dates
text: helper function look dates JRF files.

title: Retreive dates of JRF files — get_jrf_dates
code: get_jrf_dates(source = "admin", latest = FALSE, guids = FALSE)

title: Retreive dates of JRF files — get_jrf_dates
text: source string used determine format JRF file load. Options : "admin" (default), "official", "system.", "subnational". latest Use TRUE want latest file date. guids Use TRUE want file GUIDs. relevant subnational data.

title: Retreive dates of JRF files — get_jrf_dates
text: vector dates.

title: Retreive dates of JRF files — get_jrf_dates
code: get_jrf_dates() #> character(0)  get_jrf_dates("official") #> character(0)  get_jrf_dates("subnational", guids = TRUE) #> character(0)

title: Retrieve Shape data — get_shapes
text: Retrieves Shape data shared drive.

title: Retrieve Shape data — get_shapes
code: get_shapes(version_date = NULL, source = "polio", layer = "admin2", latest = T)

title: Retrieve Shape data — get_shapes
text: version_date string format "yyyy-mm", corresponding version shape file wish load. source string used determine shape file load. Options : "polio" "gadm". layer string used determine layer load. Options : "admin0", "admin1", "admin2" latest Defaults TRUE. loading polio shapes, ensures use latest shape version country given version_date. set FALSE, load file shape file versions available given version date.

title: Retrieve Shape data — get_shapes
text: sf object

title: Retrieve Shape data — get_shapes
code: # Defaults are set to polio, admin2, and latest shape version, # So you can just provide version_date: get_shapes("2022-03") #> Reading in Polio admin2 shape file dated: 2022-03 #> Error: Cannot open "C:/Users//Gavi/Measurement, Evaluation and Learning - Documents/CPMM/Datasets/Shapes/Polio/2022-03/outputs/polio_shapes_latest_2022-03.gpkg"; The file doesn't seem to exist.  # Note for GADM, no version date needed get_shapes(source = "gadm") #> Reading in GADM admin2 shape file #> Error: Cannot open "C:/Users//Gavi/Measurement, Evaluation and Learning - Documents/CPMM/Datasets/Shapes/GADM/gadm_shapes.gpkg"; The file doesn't seem to exist.  # can also add arguments to override defaults get_shapes("2022-03", layer = "admin1", latest = FALSE) #> Reading in Polio admin1 shape file dated: 2022-03 #> Error: Cannot open "C:/Users//Gavi/Measurement, Evaluation and Learning - Documents/CPMM/Datasets/Shapes/Polio/2022-03/outputs/polio_shapes_2022-03.gpkg"; The file doesn't seem to exist.

title: Retrieve Survey data — get_survey
code: get_survey("2022-08") #> Reading in National Survey file dated: 2022-08 #> Warning: cannot open compressed file 'C:/Users//Gavi/Measurement, Evaluation and Learning - Documents/CPMM/Datasets/Coverage/Survey/Database/2022-08/outputs/survey_long_2022-08.rds', probable reason 'No such file or directory' #> Error in gzfile(file, "rb"): cannot open the connection  get_survey("2022-08", source = "equity") #> Reading in Equity Survey file dated: 2022-08 #> Warning: cannot open compressed file 'C:/Users//Gavi/Measurement, Evaluation and Learning - Documents/CPMM/Datasets/Coverage/Survey/Database/2022-08/outputs/survey_equity_2022-08.rds', probable reason 'No such file or directory' #> Error in gzfile(file, "rb"): cannot open the connection

code: get_synonyms()

title: Load in the synonyms file — get_synonyms

code: get_wuenic(version_date, format = "normal")

text: WUENIC data frame

code: get_wuenic("2022-07") #> Reading in WUENIC file dated: 2022-07 #> Warning: cannot open compressed file 'C:/Users//Gavi/Measurement, Evaluation and Learning - Documents/CPMM/Datasets/Coverage/WUENIC/2022/outputs/wuenic_2022-07.rds', probable reason 'No such file or directory' #> Error in gzfile(file, "rb"): cannot open the connection  get_wuenic("2021-07", "old_new") #> Reading in WUENIC file dated: 2021-07 #> Warning: cannot open compressed file 'C:/Users//Gavi/Measurement, Evaluation and Learning - Documents/CPMM/Datasets/Coverage/WUENIC/2021/outputs/wuenic_old_new_2021-07.rds', probable reason 'No such file or directory' #> Error in gzfile(file, "rb"): cannot open the connection

title: Pipe operator — %>%
text: See magrittr::%>% details.

title: Pipe operator — %>%
code: lhs %>% rhs

title: Pipe operator — %>%
text: lhs value magrittr placeholder. rhs function call using magrittr semantics.

title: Pipe operator — %>%
text: result calling rhs(lhs).

title: Plot Gavi color scales — plot_gavi_colors
text: Helper function assist choosing Gavi color palette.

title: Plot Gavi color scales — plot_gavi_colors
code: plot_gavi_colors(pal_name = "all")

title: Plot Gavi color scales — plot_gavi_colors
text: pal_name defaults colors. Can choose list available palettes: , standard, main, strategy, vaccine, blues, purples, greens, greens3, bluegreen, redgreen, traffic, misc1, misc2, map, map blues

title: Plot Gavi color scales — plot_gavi_colors
code: plot_gavi_colors()  plot_gavi_colors("vaccine")

what: Color scales based on Gavi color palette — scale_color_gavi
title: Color scales based on Gavi color palette — scale_color_gavi
text: Color scales based Gavi color palette

title: Color scales based on Gavi color palette — scale_color_gavi
code: scale_color_gavi(palette = "standard", discrete = TRUE, reverse = FALSE, ...)

title: Color scales based on Gavi color palette — scale_color_gavi
text: palette palette. Defaults 21 Gavi colors, versions can used. Full list: , standard, millennial, main, strategy, vaccine, who_region, gavi_segment, world_bank, red_green, traffic, misc1, misc2, map_blue_red, map_blue_red2, map_orange_turquoise, map_green_red, map_blues, map_reds, map_greens. discrete Defaults TRUE, keep data discrete. continuous, used FALSE. reverse Reverses order palette. ... Additional arguments passed ggplot2::discrete_scale() ggplot2::scale_fill_gradientn(), used respectively discrete TRUE FALSE

title: Color scales based on Gavi color palette — scale_color_gavi
code: # Example one - applied to discrete data library(dplyr) library(ggplot2) wuenic %>%  filter(iso3 == "AFG" & vaccine %in% c("dtp1", "dtp3")) %>%  ggplot(aes(year, coverage, color = vaccine)) +  geom_line() +  scale_color_gavi()   # Example two - with different palette, and continuous data wuenic %>%  filter(vaccine == "dtp3" & !is.na(coverage)) %>%  ggplot(aes(year, coverage, color = coverage)) +  geom_point() +  scale_color_gavi(palette = "traffic", discrete = FALSE)

what: Fill scales based on Gavi color palette — scale_fill_gavi
title: Fill scales based on Gavi color palette — scale_fill_gavi
text: Fill scales based Gavi color palette

title: Fill scales based on Gavi color palette — scale_fill_gavi
code: scale_fill_gavi(palette = "standard", discrete = TRUE, reverse = FALSE, ...)

title: Fill scales based on Gavi color palette — scale_fill_gavi
text: palette palette. Defaults 21 Gavi colors, versions can used. Full list: , standard, millennial, main, strategy, vaccine, who_region, gavi_segment, world_bank, red_green, traffic, misc1, misc2, map_blue_red, map_blue_red2, map_orange_turquoise, map_green_red, map_blues, map_reds, map_greens.. discrete Defaults TRUE, keep data discrete. continuous, used FALSE. reverse Reverses order palette. ... Additional arguments passed ggplot2::discrete_scale() ggplot2::scale_fill_gradientn(), used respectively discrete TRUE FALSE

title: Fill scales based on Gavi color palette — scale_fill_gavi
code: # Example one - use main palette as output has four colors needed library(dplyr) library(ggplot2) wuenic %>%  filter(iso3 == "AFG" & year == 2021) %>%  ggplot(aes(vaccine, coverage, fill = vaccine)) +  geom_bar(stat = "identity") +  scale_fill_gavi(palette = "main", reverse = TRUE)   # Example two - the "misc1" palette has five colors, so palette takes first four shades wuenic %>%  filter(iso3 == "AFG" & year == 2021) %>%  ggplot(aes(vaccine, coverage, fill = vaccine)) +  geom_bar(stat = "identity") +  scale_fill_gavi(palette = "misc1", reverse = TRUE)

what: Set root for file paths — set_root
title: Set root for file paths — set_root
text: function just sets root directory filepaths. simplifies data-loading dynamically pulls username filepath.

title: Set root for file paths — set_root
code: set_root(datasets = F)

title: Set root for file paths — set_root
text: datasets set TRUE root CPMM datasets folder, otherwise leave FALSE root CPMM folder.

title: Set root for file paths — set_root
text: vector filepath root.

title: Set root for file paths — set_root
code: set_root() #> [1] "C:/Users//Gavi/Measurement, Evaluation and Learning - Documents"  # can also save as root object to re-use when loading multiple data files root <- set_root()

title: Gavi ggplot2 theme — theme_gavi
text: simple theme based hrbrthemes::theme_ipsum() slight tweaks.

title: Gavi ggplot2 theme — theme_gavi
code: theme_gavi()

title: Gavi flextable theme — theme_gavi_table
text: theme applies pretty defaults flextable. makes numerous changes, including: Making header larger, bold, black, adds border header body, left aligns first body column centers others, adds border body footer, makes footer text smaller lighter, removes padding rows.

title: Gavi flextable theme — theme_gavi_table
code: theme_gavi_table(ft)

title: Gavi flextable theme — theme_gavi_table
text: ft flextable object.

title: Gavi flextable theme — theme_gavi_table
text: DTP3 coverage high impact countries iso3 coverage COD 70 ETH 71 IND 85 PAK 77 Source: WUENIC, July 2021
code: library(dplyr) library(flextable) library(officer)  wuenic %>%   filter(year == 2020 & iso3 %in% c("COD", "ETH", "IND", "PAK") & vaccine == "dtp3") %>%   select(iso3, coverage) %>%   flextable() %>%   add_header_lines("DTP3 coverage in high impact countries") %>%   add_footer_lines("Source: WUENIC, July 2021") %>%   theme_gavi_table() .cl-8f6fb9a2{}.cl-8f613c74{font-family:'DejaVu title: WUENIC Coverage Estimates — wuenic
text: subset data /UNICEF Estimates National Vaccine Coverage. Includes variables country, year, vaccine, target, number vaccinated, coverage. Note: DTP1, DTP3, MCV1, PCV3 vaccines included.

title: WUENIC Coverage Estimates — wuenic
code: wuenic

title: WUENIC Coverage Estimates — wuenic
text: object class tbl_df (inherits tbl, data.frame) 17424 rows 6 columns.

title: WUENIC Coverage Estimates — wuenic
text: WUENIC Estimates, July 2022

title: gavir 0.1.0
text: gavir now full-fledged website Added new helper function, add_iso3(). iso3 code present country name , loads synonyms file matches country. Added new get functions, get_synonyms() get_support() Added new color palettes scale_gavi_*() functions: “standard”, “map”, “map blues”. Now default “standard”, discrete palette pretty distinctive color defaults. Updated get_ihme() follow updated folder structure, added option load ihme/admin subnational file

title: gavir 0.1.0
text: Resolved issue theme_gavi_table() function threw error officer package loaded Resolved issue get_ihme() longer throw error vaccine parameter empty

title: gavir 0.0.0.9000
text: Initial release get_* functions, allowing easy retrieval common datasets shared drive. Two new theme functions, theme_gavi() theme_gavi_table() Functions custom gavi color palettes (scale_color_gavi() scale_fill_gavi()) miscellaneous helper functions, notably set_root()
